Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# U.S. Frontier Group Holdings, Inc. (ULCC) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 10, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $3.24 (as of market close October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq)  
**Market Capitalization:** $754.2 million (as of October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $2.79 - $6.62  
**Data Sources:** Latest from SEC filings (8-K/Q2 10-Q filed August 7, 2024), earnings call transcript (August 7, 2024 via Seeking Alpha), company IR site, Bloomberg, Reuters, Yahoo Finance, Barron's articles (e.g., September 2024 coverage), Reddit/WallStreetBets discussions (high volume on engine issues), and analyst notes from JPMorgan (September 25, 2024 downgrade).

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
Frontier Group Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: ULCC), founded in 1994 and headquartered in Denver, Colorado, operates Frontier Airlines, one of the largest ultra-low-cost carriers (ULCC) in the United States. The company focuses on providing affordable air travel to leisure travelers through a network of over 140 domestic and international routes across 10 U.S. bases and Puerto Rico, serving more than 100 airports. Frontier's business model emphasizes high aircraft utilization (12-13 hours/day), single-class all-economy seating with optional add-ons (bags, seats, snacks generating ~50% of revenue), and a modern fleet of ~150 Airbus A320-family aircraft (average age 5.5 years, fuel-efficient neo variants). As of Q2 2024, it carried 7.7 million revenue passengers, with a strategy centered on low base fares to stimulate demand in underserved markets. ULCC competes by undercutting legacy carriers by 50-70% on fares while targeting price-sensitive customers. The company went public via IPO in April 2021 at $11/share but has faced post-pandemic challenges like capacity constraints and rising costs. Recent Q2 2024 results showed revenue stability amid sector headwinds, with a focus on returning to profitability through cost discipline and network growth. (198 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported August 7, 2024):** Revenue $918.2 million (down 1.4% YoY from $931.4 million); Net loss $58.0 million (vs. $27.9 million loss YoY); Adjusted EBITDA $109 million (down from $149 million). RASM (revenue per available seat mile) down 5.1% YoY due to yield pressure; CASM-ex (unit cost excl. fuel) up 4%. Fleet at 149 aircraft.
- **Pratt & Whitney Engine Inspections (Ongoing, escalated September 2024):** ~45 A320neo aircraft grounded (30% of fleet) due to contaminated engine parts; CEO Barry Biffle noted on earnings call potential for 52 groundings by year-end, delaying 2025 growth (Reuters, September 12, 2024).
- **Spirit Airlines Bid Withdrawal (February 2024):** Abandoned $2.6B merger after JetBlue-Spirit deal blocked by DOJ; ULCC stock fell 20% on news.
- **Base Expansions:** New Philadelphia base opened July 2024 (5 aircraft, 15 routes); Cleveland base added September 2024 (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **Leadership Changes:** EVP Jim Hete retired September 2024; cost-cutting measures announced targeting $100M+ savings in 2025.
- **Online Buzz:** High Reddit volume (r/wallstreetbets, r/stocks) on engine issues and "bankruptcy risk" (October 2024 threads); short interest ~15% (up from 10% in July).

## Growth Strategy
- **Network Expansion:** Add 30+ new routes in H2 2024; target 15% ASMs (available seat miles) growth in 2025 pending engine resolutions (earnings call).
- **Fleet Modernization:** 204 A320neo orders (210 deliveries through 2032); deferrals to manage cash amid inspections.
- **Ancillary Revenue Focus:** Grow to 55% of total revenue via "My Frontier" loyalty program (1.5M members, up 20% YoY).
- **Cost Controls:** Achieve CASM-ex flat in 2025 via labor deals and efficiencies.
- **International Push:** Expand Mexico/Caribbean routes (15% of capacity).

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Pratt & Whitney engine groundings (45 planes offline, $50-75M EBITDA hit in 2025 per JPMorgan Sept 25 note); ongoing losses (TTM net loss $109M); high debt ($2.3B, leverage 4.5x EBITDA); deferred deliveries hurting growth. | Modern fleet (lowest fuel burn/seat); strong leisure demand; new bases driving local traffic. |
| **Sector-Wide** | Fuel prices up 10% YoY ($2.80/gal Q2); softening leisure yields (down 6% industry-wide); overcapacity from majors; recession fears (Boeing demand drop). | Robust U.S. travel demand (TSA screenings +5% YoY Sept 2024); falling oil prices (WTI $73/bbl Oct 10); LCC model resilient in downturns. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Offering:** Ultra-low fares on point-to-point routes (avg. $50-100 one-way); 100% Airbus A320/321 fleet (149 aircraft: 52 A319, 64 A320ceo, 33 A320neo).
- **Ancillary Revenue (~50% total):** Bag fees ($30-60), seat selection ($10-100), snacks/WiFi ($5-10).
- **Loyalty Program:** My Frontier (free flights/miles).
- **Cargo/Other:** Minimal (~1% revenue).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Elite Status Tiers (Launched Q3 2024):** Premium perks for high-spenders to boost loyalty.
- **Route Launches:** 15 new destinations H2 2024 (e.g., Philly-Cancun Oct 17, Cleveland-Tampa Nov 2024).
- **Sustainability Initiatives:** Sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) trials planned 2025 with partners.
- **Tech Upgrades:** App enhancements for personalized upselling (Q4 2024 rollout).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current U.S. Domestic Market Share:** ~5.2% by ASMs (Q2 2024, per Cirium/DOT data; vs. Southwest 19%, Delta 17%).
- **Forecast:** Decline to 4.8-5.0% in 2025 due to groundings constraining capacity (JPMorgan est.); potential rebound to 6% by 2027 with deliveries (company guidance assumes 10% ASM CAGR 2025-2028).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (Q2 2024 or Latest) | ULCC | Spirit (SAVE) | Allegiant (ALGT) | Southwest (LUV) |
|----------------------------|------|---------------|------------------|-----------------|
| **Revenue ($M)** | 918 | 1,338 (down 5%) | 682 (up 3%) | 6,880 (down 5%) |
| **Net Loss ($M)** | (58) | (148) | (21) | (78) |
| **RASM YoY** | -5.1% | -10% | +1% | -6% |
| **Fleet Size** | 149 | 205 | 123 | 817 |
| **Market Share (ASMs)** | 5.2% | 4.5% | 2.1% | 19% |
| **Stock YTD** | -48% | -85% | -30% | -25% |

*ULCC outperforms Spirit on cost control but lags Allegiant's profitability; cheaper valuation (0.8x 2025 EV/Sales vs. peers 1.0-1.5x).*

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships:** Airbus (fleet supplier); Pratt & Whitney (engines, despite issues); Google Cloud (booking tech, renewed 2024); TripActions (corporate travel pilot).
- **M&A:** No active deals post-Spirit withdrawal; opportunistic for smaller regionals (CEO comments on call). Raised $50M convertible notes September 2024 for liquidity.

## Current & Potential Major Clients
- **Current:** Leisure-heavy (90%+); corporate ~10% via TripActions. Key routes: Denver-Las Vegas (top performer).
- **Potential:** Expand corporate share to 20% (target via elite program); leisure growth in secondary markets (e.g., Mid-Atlantic via Philly base).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** Top-quartile fuel efficiency (0.15 gal/100 ASM); DEI initiatives (40% diverse workforce).
- **Management Quality:** CEO Barry Biffle (ex-Spirit) credited with turnarounds; insider ownership 30%.
- **Risks:** High beta (2.1); liquidity $600M cash (Q2) but burn rate concerns.
- **Analyst Consensus:** 7 Holds, 1 Sell (avg. PT $6.50, per MarketBeat Oct 10).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 4/10 (Hold/Sell bias). Engine groundings cap near-term growth (2025 EPS est. -$0.20 vs. consensus -$0.10); debt and yields pressure valuation. Upside limited without resolution.
- **Fair Value Estimate:** $5.50/share (moderate growth portfolio, 20% upside). DCF-based (8% WACC, 3% terminal growth, 2025 revenue $3.9B, EBITDA margin 12%) assuming engine fixes by mid-2025; aligns with 1.2x 2026 EV/Sales (peer avg.). Strong growth requires flawless executionâ€”moderate risk appetite favors waiting for Q3 earnings (Nov 2024).
